experience.title: Data Analyst Intern at AI Labs
experience.description: I had a very amazing experience interning at American Express. I was part of the Artificial Intelligence Learning and Governance, a branch of the Global Decision Sciences Team at Amex. During my internship, I worked on two projects. I started out with “Amex Insights – Leveraging layout information for marketing creative evaluation” where in Graph Neural Networks were used to embed the creative for analysis. We were able to evaluate the creatives as a whole up to nearly 96% accuracy. Furthermore, the model was built in such a way which allows for certain node level explanations and comparisons. After nearly 3 weeks into the internship, I took up another project “Financial Statement Spreading – Extract and Store Metadata with Financial Statements” which entailed extraction of data about tabular data in financial statements. I wrote a Custom Date Parser that was able to correctly infer a valid partial or complete date from a text up to 92% accuracy. I also worked on extracting sub headings from the document albeit the accuracy could only reach 50% due to the difficulty in correctly identifying a sub heading from all other text.Thanks to the amazing team at Amex, I was able to manage my time in both projects and deliver substantial results in both. They had a very inclusive and welcoming work culture, which enabled me to bring my best and authentic self to work.
experience.description_html: I had a very amazing experience interning at American Express. I was part of the Artificial Intelligence Learning and Governance, a branch of the Global Decision Sciences Team at Amex. During my internship, I worked on two projects. I started out with “Amex Insights – Leveraging layout information for marketing creative evaluation” where in Graph Neural Networks were used to embed the creative for analysis. We were able to evaluate the creatives as a whole up to nearly 96% accuracy. Furthermore, the model was built in such a way which allows for certain node level explanations and comparisons. After nearly 3 weeks into the internship, I took up another project “Financial Statement Spreading – Extract and Store Metadata with Financial Statements” which entailed extraction of data about tabular data in financial statements. I wrote a Custom Date Parser that was able to correctly infer a valid partial or complete date from a text up to 92% accuracy. I also worked on extracting sub headings from the document albeit the accuracy could only reach 50% due to the difficulty in correctly identifying a sub heading from all other text.Thanks to the amazing team at Amex, I was able to manage my time in both projects and deliver substantial results in both. They had a very inclusive and welcoming work culture, which enabled me to bring my best and authentic self to work.

experience.title: Data Science and Business Analytics Intern
experience.description: This internship opportunity given to me by The Sparks Foundation gave me a taste in Data Science and Business Analysis. It was a wonderful experience in which I had learnt to use Business Intelligence tools like Tableau and PowerBI. Well, I didn't stop at this but took a step ahead and completed tasks from another domain Computer Vision and Internet Of Things wherein I modeled an Object Detector and a Color Detector.

experience.title: Member of Unit 1
experience.description: The annual NSS camp was held from 28 November - 4 December. The activities were centered around Shyameshwarpur and encompassed the villages of, Nachna and Sholadhar. Around 550 first-year students participated in the camp. The camp was inaugurated by Prof. Somesh Kumar (Dean SA, IIT Kharagpur) who appreciated the work done by NSS in the past and inspired the students to do their best. During the annual camp, NSS volunteers participated in the construction of a nearly 1 km long drain, designed to relieve water congestion during the monsoon. They also cleared a nearly 400 m long path, which was overgrown and impassable, and made it suitable for use by the villagers.
experience.description_html: The annual NSS camp was held from 28 November - 4 December. The activities were centered around Shyameshwarpur and encompassed the villages of, Nachna and Sholadhar. Throwing light on the problems of this current world put me in deep thought and I realised that we all must work together in this to tell our future generation that the world can still be made better.

          The annual NSS camp was held from 28 November - 4 December. The activities were centered around Shyameshwarpur, and encompassed the villages of, Nachna and Sholadhar. Around 550 first year students participated in the camp. The camp was inaugurated by Prof. Somesh Kumar (Dean SA, IIT Kharagpur) who appreciated the work done by NSSin the past, and inspired the students to do their best. During the annual camp, NSS volunteers participated in the construction of a nearly 1 km long drain, designed to relieve water congestion during the monsoon. They also cleared a nearly 400 m long path, which was overgrown and impassable, and made it suitable for use by the villagers.

projects: [{"title":"Decision Tree Classifier - A New Look - Using Kmeans Clustering Inertia as a Evaluation Metric","start_date":"Apr 2022","end_date":"May 2022","description":"A decision tree classifier is implemented and tested on the Avila dataset obtained from UCI Machine Learning Repository. BUT, a completely different evaluation criterion is used at each non-leaf node of the decision tree when choosing a decision attribute at that node."},{"title":"Pharmacy Management System and Portal - The Web Application","start_date":"Feb 2022","end_date":"Mar 2022","description":"The pharmacy management system and portal is built to efficiently manage the inventory of the pharmacy as well as providing the customers with a online portal using which they can easily view the pharmacy at a glance without physically visiting it."},{"title":"Pharmacy Portal - The Android App","start_date":"Feb 2022","end_date":"Mar 2022","description":"The pharmacy portal is built to provide the customers with a online portal using which they can easily view the pharmacy at a glance without physically visiting it."},{"title":"Multi-Layer Perceptron Classifier","start_date":"Oct 2021","end_date":"Nov 2021","description":"This dataset is originally from the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases. The objective is to predict based on diagnostic measurements whether a patient has diabetes."},{"title":"K-Means Clustering","start_date":"Sep 2021","end_date":"Oct 2021","description":"The first 5 variables are all blood tests which are thought to be sensitive to liver disorders that might arise from excessive alcohol consumption. Each line in the dataset constitutes the record of a single male individual.The task requires us to cluster the samples based on the following attributes: Attribute information:1. mcvmean corpuscular volume2. alkphosalkaline phosphotase3. sgptalamine aminotransferase4. sgot aspartate aminotransferase5. gammagtgamma-glutamyl transpeptidase6. drinksnumber of half-pint equivalents of alcoholic beverages drunk per day"},{"title":"Decision Tree Classifier","start_date":"Aug 2021","end_date":"Sep 2021","description":"The Avila data set has been extracted from 800 images of the 'Avila Bible', an XII century giant Latin copy of the Bible. The prediction task consists in associating each pattern to a copyist. The task requires us to classify a sample into one of the classes A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, W, X, Y based on the following attributes: F1: intercolumnar distance , F2: upper margin, F3: lower margin, F4: exploitation, F5: row number, F6: modular ratio, F7: interlinear spacing, F8: weight, F9: peak number, F10: modular ratio/ interlinear spacing."},{"title":"Medicine Shop Automation Software","start_date":"Feb 2021","end_date":"Apr 2021","description":"The Medicine Shop Automation Software’s purpose is to automate Medicine Shop management and ease the shop owner’s workload. It is a convenient and easy-to-use application for the shop owner who has to deal with managing the medicine shop’s inventories and undergo various types of procedures involving transactions with vendors of the medicines and customers who buy the medicines. The system is based on a relational database with its Medicine Inventory and Transaction Records. It can handle efficient storage of data and provides the user with various functionalities. Above all, the software aims to provide a comfortable user experience to the medicine shop owners."}]
